text.p: Following are the main stories in Croatian newspapers on Tuesday.
- Prime Minister Zlatko Matesa to spend April 1-8 in the United States.
- Croatian Democratic Union (HDZ) representatives and journalists come under a barrage of stones thrown at them by an angry Serb mob during a Vukovar HDZ election campaign rally.
- The Ron Brown memorial centre opens in Dubrovnik to commemorate his death in a plane crash a year ago.
- Money market: The highest rates in eight months recorded last week.
- Dubrovnik is expecting to rake in some 140 million German marks from tourism this season, according to the local tourist organisation.
- Albanian author Ismail Kadare sues journalist Branimir Brljevic for publishing a made-up interview with him in the Croatian daily Novi List from Rijeka. -- Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
